title: Hegseth Said to Have Shared Attack Details in Second Signal Chat
abstract: The defense secretary sent sensitive information about strikes in Yemen to an encrypted group chat that included his wife and brother, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Trump Administration Draft Order Calls for Drastic Overhaul of State Department
abstract: The draft executive order would eliminate Africa operations and shut down bureaus working on democracy, human rights and refugee issues.

title: Pope Meets With JD Vance After Criticism of Trump Administration
abstract: Francis and the vice president briefly exchanged Easter wishes, the Vatican said. An earlier meeting between Mr. Vance and church officials involved “an exchange of opinions” on migration.

title: Alito Releases Dissent in Supreme Court Decision Blocking Deportations
abstract: Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. wrote that the court’s overnight order blocking the Trump administration from deporting a group of Venezuelans under a wartime law was not “necessary or appropriate.”

title: Every Doctor Faces This Dilemma
abstract: Some physicians agree to patients’ requests for unproven treatment or altered vaccine schedules.

title: How the War Over Trans Athletes Tore a Volleyball Team Apart
abstract: Blaire Fleming was a little-known college player. Then she suddenly became a symbol of injustice — to both sides of the controversy.

title: A Different Kind of F.B.I. Chief: Jet-Setting Patel Loves the Limelight
abstract: Kash Patel’s embrace of the spotlight appears to be a break from the recent past, as his predecessors typically did the job with little fanfare.

title: Sherrod Brown: What Worries Me Most About Trump’s Failing Economy
abstract: Democrats should not confuse Trump’s tariff disaster for a trade policy that helps workers.

title: Will This Conservative Legal Doctrine Undo Trump’s First Months in Office?
abstract: What goes around, comes around. And it is not likely to be good for the White House.

title: The Trade Adviser Who Hates Trade
abstract: Once sidelined, President Trump’s counselor Peter Navarro has returned to Washington and quickly upended the global trading system.

title: An Age of Extinction Is Coming. Here’s How to Survive.
abstract: Everything is under threat. What you care about can make it to the other side.

title: 6 Killed as Giant Waves Batter Australia
abstract: The victims fell or were swept into the ocean, according to the police, as swells pounded Sydney and other places along the country’s east coast. At least two others were missing.

title: Judge Rules Against Trump Administration on Passport Changes
abstract: A group of transgender plaintiffs sued President Trump and the State Department over a new rule prohibiting passports from including a gender different from the sex listed on an original birth certificate.

title: The World’s Most Anticipated Museum Is Finally Open. (Well, Mostly.)
abstract: The Grand Egyptian Museum, outside Cairo, has been delayed by revolutions, wars, financial crises and a pandemic. At long last, here’s a look inside.

title: The Trump Billionaires Who Run the Economy and the Things They Say
abstract: “You have to laugh to keep from crying,” one Republican pollster said about recent comments by the billionaires on the stock market, retirement funds and Social Security.

title: Mother and Son, 8, Found Dead in Bronx Home With Daughter, 4, Left Alone
abstract: It was not immediately clear how long the two had been dead or how long the younger daughter had been surviving alone in the apartment.

title: An Urgent Supreme Court Order Protecting Migrants Was Built for Speed
abstract: In an overnight ruling blocking the Trump administration from deporting a group of Venezuelans, the justices ignored some of their protocols.

title: A Simple Slogan Creates a Shirt and a Sensation
abstract: The designer Conner Ives hoped to do some good with his “Protect the Dolls” T-shirt. Worn by celebrities, and sold out online, the shirts are raising money for a trans cause.

title: Inside the Urgent Fight Over the Trump Administration’s New Deportation Effort
abstract: The push to deport a group of Venezuelans raises questions about whether the government is following a Supreme Court order requiring that migrants receive due process.

title: An Inside Look at the Subway’s Archaic Signal System
abstract: Vast swaths of the subway still rely on signal equipment from the Great Depression. A  multibillion dollar plan, now at risk, hopes to bring the system into the 21st century

title: Trump Officials Blame Mistake for Setting Off Confrontation With Harvard
abstract: An official on the administration’s antisemitism task force told the university that a letter of demands had been sent without authorization.

title: Trump Administration Will Freeze $2 Billion After Harvard Refuses Demands
abstract: Federal officials said they would freeze the money after Harvard said it would not submit to requests to overhaul hiring and report international students who break rules.

title: A Startling Admission From a G.O.P. Senator: ‘We Are All Afraid’
abstract: Lisa Murkowski, a longtime senator from Alaska and an independent voice in an increasingly tribal party, has been the rare Republican on Capitol Hill willing to criticize President Trump’s actions.

title: Astronomers Detect a Possible Signature of Life on a Distant Planet
abstract: Further studies are needed to determine whether K2-18b, which orbits a star 120 light-years away, is inhabited, or even habitable.

title: What’s Happening Is Not Normal. America Needs an Uprising That Is Not Normal.
abstract: It will take a concerted effort by every sector of our society to respond to Trumpism’s threat.

title: Head of I.R.S. Is Ousted in Treasury’s Power Struggle With Elon Musk
abstract: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent complained to President Trump that the acting commissioner had been installed without his knowledge.

title: I Have Never Been More Afraid for My Country’s Future
abstract: Trump’s worldview is stuck in the 1970s, and his whole administration is a cruel farce.

title: Why Harvard Decided to Fight Trump
abstract: The Trump administration will freeze over $2 billion in federal funds because Harvard refused to comply with a list of demands. Harvard leaders believed saying no was worth the risk.

title: The Vibe Shifts Against the Right
abstract: People who once found right-wing ideas scintillating are having second thoughts as they watch Trump put those ideas into practice.

title: Columbia Activist Arrested by ICE at His Appointment for Citizenship
abstract: Mohsen Mahdawi, a legal permanent resident, has lived in the United States for 10 years and was arrested in Vermont. He has not been charged with a crime.

title: James Carville: How to Turn Trump’s Economic Chaos Against Him
abstract: Tie the president to the people’s pain, and make the message local.

title: How 13 Independent Voters Who Backed Trump Think He Is Doing So Far
abstract: The participants discuss how they think Trump’s second term is going.

title: Trump Administration Says It Will Take Over Renovation of Penn Station
abstract: The head of the federal Department of Transportation promised on Thursday to take away control of the project from the Metropolitan Transportation Authority.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Arguments on Trump Plan to End Birthright Citizenship
abstract: The Trump administration had asked the justices to lift a nationwide pause on the policy as lower court challenges continue.

title: Trump Lashes Out at Fed Chair for Not Cutting Rates
abstract: Jerome Powell has said that the Federal Reserve can be patient as the effects of tariffs become more clear. President Trump, pushing for interest rate cuts, said, “Powell’s termination cannot come fast enough!”

title: Daily Pill May Work as Well as Ozempic for Weight Loss and Blood Sugar
abstract: Eli Lilly said clinical results of its GLP-1 in pill form showed safety and efficacy data similar to blockbuster injectable drugs.

title: Rubio Says U.S. to Decide in Days if End to War in Ukraine Is ‘Doable’
abstract: “If it is not possible to end the war in Ukraine, we need to move on,” Secretary of State Marco Rubio said as he departed meetings in Paris.

title: Val Kilmer, Film Star Who Played Batman and Jim Morrison, Dies at 65
abstract: A wide-ranging leading man who earned critical praise, he was known to be charismatic but unpredictable. At one point he dropped out of Hollywood for a decade.

title: Hillary Clinton: How Much Dumber Will This Get?
abstract: The Signal group chat is only the latest in a string of self-inflicted wounds by the new administration.

title: 10 Small Things Neurologists Wish You’d Do for Your Brain
abstract: Easy everyday habits can help keep you sharp. And it’s never too late to start them.

title: The Secret History of the War in Ukraine
abstract: This is the untold story of America’s hidden role in Ukrainian military operations against Russia’s invading armies.

title: Cory Booker Condemns Trump’s Policies in Longest Senate Speech on Record
abstract: The New Jersey senator spent much of his speech, which ended after more than 25 hours, assailing the Trump administration. He eclipsed Strom Thurmond’s filibuster of a civil rights bill in 1957.

title: Wisconsin Supreme Court Election Results
abstract: Get live results and maps from the 2025 Wisconsin spring elections.

title: Suspect Charged in Arson at Pennsylvania Governor’s Mansion
abstract: A man was charged with setting fire to the residence, forcing Gov. Josh Shapiro and his family to flee. Investigators said they found beer bottles with gasoline inside the house.

title: The Leaked Signal Chat, Annotated
abstract: The chat’s contents, which were obtained by The Atlantic after its editor in chief was added to the Signal group, provide a revealing look at private conversations between top Trump administration officials.

title: He Was Held Captive in His Room for Decades. Then He Set It on Fire.
abstract: Firefighters found a 32-year-old man who weighed 68 pounds. The police say his stepmother locked him away when he was 12.

title: Supreme Court Sides With Wrongly Deported Migrant
abstract: A trial judge had ordered the Trump administration to take steps to return the migrant, Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia, from a notorious prison in El Salvador.

title: How to Protect Your Retirement Savings Now as Markets Plunge
abstract: If you’re within five years of retiring, either before or after, you’re at your most vulnerable financially. Here are steps to weather the volatility.

title: Mass Protests Across the Country Show Resistance to Trump
abstract: Demonstrators packed the streets in cities and towns to rail against government cutbacks, financial turmoil and what they viewed as attacks on democracy.

title: The Gen X Career Meltdown
abstract: Just when they should be at their peak, experienced workers in creative fields find that their skills are all but obsolete.

title: Have We Been Thinking About A.D.H.D. All Wrong?
abstract: With diagnoses at a record high, some experts have begun to question our assumptions about the condition — and how to treat it.

title: Wisconsin Spring Election Results
abstract: Get live results and maps from the 2025 Wisconsin spring elections.

title: Francis Worked to Make Catholic Church More Inclusive
abstract: Pope Francis sought to make the church more welcoming, global and collegial, after his predecessors adopted more doctrinaire and traditional approaches.

title: Francis, the First Latin American Pope, Dies at 88
abstract: After decades of conservative leadership, Francis tried to reset the course of the Roman Catholic Church, emphasizing inclusion and care for the marginalized over doctrinal purity.

title: Pope Francis’ Life
abstract: Selected photographs from the life and papacy of Pope Francis.

title: Trump Raised $239 Million for Inauguration, More Than Doubling His Own Record
abstract: The staggering amount, disclosed in a filing with the Federal Election Commission, was driven by corporate America’s eagerness to win the president’s favor.

title: Markets Slump on Persistent Concern That Tariffs Will Hurt Growth
abstract: Trump’s tariffs continued to jar investors on Monday as stocks in Asia mostly fell and the U.S. dollar weakened.

title: Bukele Proposes Deal That Would Free Deported Venezuelans
abstract: President Nayib Bukele said he would free the Venezuelans that the Trump administration deported to El Salvador if Venezuela released the same number of prisoners, including members of the opposition.

title: Read Justice Alito’s Dissent
abstract: Justice Samuel A. Alito Jr. wrote that the Supreme Court’s decision to block the Trump administration from deporting Venezuelan migrants under a wartime law was premature.

title: Bunnies, Bonnets, Brights and Blooms at New York’s Easter Parade
abstract: Time for revelry, and a celebration of spring, on a Sunday in the city.

title: Israel’s Military Cites ‘Professional Failures’ in Killings of Gaza Medics
abstract: In a statement and a briefing summarizing its investigation into the deadly episode, the military said a deputy commander would be dismissed.

title: Video Shows Aid Workers Killed in Gaza Under Gunfire Barrage, With Ambulance Lights On
abstract: The U.N. has said Israel killed the workers. The video appears to contradict Israel’s version of events, which said the vehicles were “advancing suspiciously” without headlights or emergency signals.

title: Syria’s Easter Celebrations Pass Peacefully, in Early Test of New Government
abstract: At least in the capital, Damascus, the Christian holiday festivities were protected and joyfully observed. Religious minorities are still wary, however, about the new leaders’ commitment to inclusivity.

title: Inside a City Swept by Roving Gunmen, Deadly Grudges and Fear
abstract: A sectarian-fueled killing spree exposed how fragile peace is in Syria, where the government’s control is limited and tension runs deep after nearly 14 years of civil war.

title: San Jose Considers Arresting Homeless People Who Refuse Housing
abstract: The mayor of the Silicon Valley city has proposed arresting people who don’t accept offers of shelter. It’s the latest sign of frustrations over tent encampments in California.

title: When They Don’t Recognize You Anymore
abstract: People with dementia often forget even close family members as the disease advances. “It can throw people into an existential crisis,” one expert said.

title: There’s a Reason the World Is a Mess, and It’s Not Trump
abstract: Global economic stagnation underlies today’s disarray.

title: There’s a Feeling We’re Not in Hollywood Anymore
abstract: Movies and TV productions are rapidly leaving California to film outside the United States, where labor costs are lower and tax incentives greater. Industry workers are exasperated.

title: 3 Men Die in Fire in Overcrowded House in Queens
abstract: The house in the Jamaica Estates neighborhood had no working smoke detectors and was crammed with tenants, fire officials said.

title: Severe Weather Kills 3 in Oklahoma as Storms Move East
abstract: Two people died after their vehicle was trapped in floodwaters and one person was killed in a tornado, officials said. Severe weather threatened parts of Arkansas and Missouri on Sunday.

title: In Trump’s America, There Are No Rules, Only Access
abstract: The real story about Trump’s tariffs may not be about trade. In many ways, it’s about power.

title: Undercutting the Progress of American Science
abstract: Readers worry about the Trump administration’s cuts to research funding.

title: Were You Raised in a Church That Fears the World or Loves Its Neighbors?
abstract: As anger and fear dominate the public square, a church that follows a resurrected savior should be a balm, not a blowtorch.

title: ‘Huge Increases in Prices for American Working Families’: Three Experts on What Trump’s Economic Policy Means
abstract: A look at tariffs, the Fed, the dollar and how uncertainty is wreaking havoc on financial markets.

title: The Darfur Genocide Never Ended
abstract: As Sudan’s soldiers and rebels continue to fight, the one constant seems to be that Sudanese civilians bear the brunt of their abuse.

title: This Is How Far Vance Will Go to Sell a Lie
abstract: Unfortunately for his argument, the Constitution is the Constitution.

title: What Trump Isn’t Telling You About His Trade War With China
abstract: What happens if we run out of rare-earth metals or bond prices collapse?

title: The Naval Academy Canceled My Lecture on Wisdom
abstract: How a lecture to the U.S. Naval Academy on censorship was censored.

title: Trump Just Scrapped My Anti-Kremlin Streaming Platform
abstract: We called it Votvot — Russian for “any minute now.”

title: What It Can Take to Make a Baby
abstract: Readers discuss the moral, ethical, religious and legal implications of the different ways I.V.F. can be used.

title: What I Didn’t Know About the Egg Industry Horrified Me
abstract: I have raised and loved so many hens from the time they were chicks. Why did I never think to ask about the fate of their brothers?

title: Our Foreign Students Are Terrified, and They’re Right to Be
abstract: The immigration crackdown has come to America’s campuses.

title: How ‘The White Lotus’ Ran Aground
abstract: The HBO hit’s theological problems.

title: Calls for Mass Resistance to Trump
abstract: Readers respond to a column by David Brooks. Also: The C.D.C.’s Injury Center; slashing the government; a retreat from D.E.I. in private schools.

title: If You Care About Your Savings, Pay Attention to Trump’s Attack on The Fed
abstract: The president’s threat to fire Jerome Powell is more than a personal spat. It’s a direct challenge to the economic foundation that has helped America prosper.

title: Kennedy’s Vaccine Hypocrisy Is Unsustainable
abstract: Did anyone really think Kennedy would soften his hostility to vaccines?

title: The Trump Administration Is Disappearing People Like the Soviet Union
abstract: The courts can only do so much to protect us. Will more people be doomed to the fate of Kilmar Abrego Garcia?

title: My School District Could Have Avoided This Supreme Court Case
abstract: Our community failed to resolve tension over L.G.B.T.Q.-themed books with the time-tested tools of straight talk, compromise and extending one another a little grace.

title: Sign Up for the Science Times Newsletter
abstract: Every week, we’ll bring you stories that capture the wonders of the human body, nature and the cosmos.

title: Hidden Above a Trap Door, 17th-Century Frescoes Come to Light
abstract: While inspecting a sumptuous villa in Rome, an electrician stumbled across long lost works by the Baroque painter Carlo Maratta.

title: Trump-Allied Prosecutor Sends Letters to Medical Journals Alleging Bias
abstract: An interim U.S. attorney is demanding information about the selection of research articles and the role of N.I.H. Experts worry this will have a chilling effect on publications.

title: Joe Nickell, Paranormal Investigator and ‘Real-Life Scully,’ Dies at 80
abstract: A professional skeptic, he took on hundreds of mysteries, offering rational explanations for the Loch Ness monster, the Shroud of Turin and countless hauntings.

title: On New Website, Trump Declares Lab Leak as ‘True Origins’ of Covid
abstract: The White House has thrown its weight behind the lab leak theory, an idea that has divided intelligence agencies.

title: Trump Opens a Huge Marine Protected Zone to Commercial Fishing
abstract: The president said the move was aimed at making the United States the world’s “dominant seafood leader.”

title: What to Know About Eli Lilly’s Daily Pill for Weight Loss
abstract: Eli Lilly reported promising results from a study of its experimental oral drug that could rival popular injections to treat obesity and diabetes.

title: Here’s What to Know About Rare Earth Minerals and Renewable Energy
abstract: The shift to cleaner power needs resources from China. An export ban just cut off some supplies.

title: Measles Outbreaks in Canada and Mexico Bring Grim Prognosis
abstract: Surges in Mennonite communities near the U.S. border may complicate containment efforts, experts say.

title: By Redefining ‘Harm,’ Agencies Aim to End Longstanding Wildlife Protections
abstract: Trump officials have proposed changing a decades-old interpretation of a key word in the Endangered Species Act, which would make it much easier to log, build or drill for oil.

title: Climate Change Is Stressing the World’s Blood Supplies
abstract: Extreme weather disasters, increasing as the planet warms, can curb blood donations while increasing demand, a new analysis found.

title: Kennedy Calls Autism ‘Preventable,’ Drawing Ire From Researchers
abstract: The health secretary said he would prioritize studies into environmental causes while harshly discounting other factors scientists say are likely contributing to rising rates of the condition.

title: 2 Judges Order Federal Agencies to Unfreeze Climate Money
abstract: The rulings are setbacks to Trump’s efforts to halt climate and environmental funding approved under the Biden administration.

title: Faces From a Meth Surge
abstract: The devastating stimulant has been hitting Portland, Maine hard, even competing with fentanyl as the street drug of choice. Although a fentanyl overdose can be reversed with Narcan, no medicine can reverse a meth overdose. Nor has any been approved to treat meth addiction.Unlike fentanyl, which sedates users, meth  can make people anxious and violent. Its effects can overwhelm not just users but community residents and emergency responders.Here are voices from one troubled neighborhood.

title: What to Know About Today’s Meth
abstract: The highly addictive drug, manufactured almost exclusively by Mexican cartels, is more dangerous than ever. Its use has been surging across the country. Unlike fentanyl, there are no medicines that can swiftly reverse a meth overdose and none approved to treat meth addiction.

title: As Fentanyl Deaths Slow, Meth Comes for Maine
abstract: A powerful stimulant that keeps users sleepless for days and can ignite psychosis and violence has been rattling Portland and its safety networks.

title: Trump Seeks to Lower Drug Prices Through Medicare and Some Imports
abstract: President Trump directed his administration to help states import drugs from Canada. But a proposal to alter a Medicare program to reduce costs could wind up raising prices.

title: Autism Rate Continues to Rise Among Children, C.D.C. Reports
abstract: While the agency stressed that increased screening was most likely behind much of the increase, the health secretary, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., called it an “epidemic.”

title: How Trump Might Unwittingly Cut Emissions From Online Shopping
abstract: Fast fashion retailers rely heavily on shipping by air. The president’s tariffs could change that.

title: This Therapist Helped Clients Feel Better. It Was A.I.
abstract: In the first clinical trial of its kind, an A.I. chatbot eased mental health symptoms among participants. The technology may someday help solve the provider shortage.

title: Trump’s Tariff Threat for Imported Medicines Poses Political Risks
abstract: Levies on Americans’ daily prescriptions and other medicines could raise costs, spur rationing and lead to shortages of critical drugs.

title: A Scientist Is Paid to Study Maple Syrup. He’s Also Paid to Promote It.
abstract: Funded by the maple industry, a researcher has exaggerated his findings to suggest that syrup could help prevent serious diseases.

title: Older People Seeking Care for Cannabis Use at Greater Risk for Dementia, Study Finds
abstract: Users needing emergency care or hospitalization were more likely to later develop dementia, researchers reported. That does not prove cannabis was the cause.
